    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Ambush Tactics](/Feats.aspx?ID=3905) <actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Kingmaker</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Kingmaker Companion Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=151) pg. 35</row>

**Prerequisites**
trained in [Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) about a specific terrain

</column>

---

You've made a study of the best practices for laying ambushes in terrains you've spent time learning about, be it the best way to ambush foes or the best methods of reacting to surprise attacks in those terrains. In any combat during which an enemy rolls [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) to determine initiative, you can choose to roll initiative using a Lore check that's appropriate for the encounter's terrain, if you're trained in the appropriate Lore skill.

<title level="2">Adventuring with Jubilost</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Kingmaker Companion Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=151) pg. 35</row>

Jubilost provides support in battle with his alchemical bombs and elixirs, but he's just as helpful when he spends time at home. As long as he's a companion, he'll serve as a source for alchemical items of his level or lower for purchase at regular prices, but if made Helpful, he provides these resources to the PCs at cost. His studies also result in the development of two new skill feats; while Jubilost doesn't take these feats himself (ever the theoretician), once the PCs have at least 4 Influence with him, these feats and formulas become available as PC options at the appropriate level.

**Related Feats**: [Efficient Explorer](/Feats.aspx?ID=3906)
